required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Camrelizumab As Consolidation Therapy After Radical Concurrent Chemoradiotherapy In Locally Advanced ESCC
clinical_study.official_title: A Study of Camrelizumab As Consolidation Therapy After Radical Concurrent Chemoradiotherapy In Locally Advanced Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess efficacy and safety of patients who receive camrelizumab as consolidation therapy after radical concurrent chemoradiotherapy in locally advanced ESCC.

detailed_description.textblock: In this study, 40 patients with locally advanced ESCC will be enrolled. All patients who had received radical concurrent chemoradiotherapy were treated with camrelizumab.

primary_outcome.time_frame: evaluated in 24 months since the treatment began
primary_outcome.description: Baseline to measured date of progression or death from any cause

secondary_outcome.time_frame: tumor assessment every 6 weeks since the treatment began，up to 24 months
tumor assessment every 6 weeks since the treatment began，up to 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: From the first assessment to CR or PR to the first assessment to PD or death from any cause

secondary_outcome.time_frame: the first day of treatment to death or last survival confirm date,up to 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline to measured date of death from any cause
Toxicity according to the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) Version 4.03. The number of Participants with adverse events will be recorded at each treatment visit

other_outcome.description: Relationship between tumor markers and efficacy in tumor tissues and peripheral blood (including but not limited to PD-L1, TMB, etc.)

arm_group.description: All patients who had received radical concurrent chemoradiotherapy were treated with camrelizumab.

intervention.description: Camrelizumab: 200 mg was given intravenously over a period of 30 minutes (no less than 20 minutes and no longer than 60 minutes)

facility.name: Fourth Hospital of Hebei Medical University
